title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 1. (1) These Rules, which may be cited as the Rules of the Superior Courts
text_raw:
1. (1) These Rules, which may be cited as the Rules of the Superior Courts 
(Judges’ Robes) 2020, shall come into operation on the 10th day of November

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 2. The Rules of the Superior Courts are amended by the substitution for
text_raw:
2. The Rules of the Superior Courts are amended by the substitution for 

Order 119 of the following Order: 

“Order 119 - Mode of Address of Judges; Robes of Bench
text_norm: 2 rule superior court amended substitution order 119 following order order 119 - mode address judge robe bench

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 1. (1) The Chief Justice, the President of the Court of Appeal and the
text_raw:
1. (1) The Chief Justice, the President of the Court of Appeal and the 
President of the High Court shall be addressed, in Court, by their 
respective titles in Irish or English and other Judges of the Superior 
Courts shall be addressed, in Court, individually, in Irish, as “A 
Bhreithimh” or, in English, as “Judge”. Judges of the Superior Courts 
may be referred to, in Irish, as “An Chúirt” or, in English, as “The Court”. 

(2) This Rule does not affect the existing practice by which Judges 
of the Superior Courts shall be addressed or referred to, other than in 
Court, by their respective titles and names, in Irish or in English.
text_norm: 1 (1) chief justice president court appeal president high court shall addressed court respective title irish english judge superior court shall addressed court individually irish bhreithimh english judge  judge superior court may referred irish chuirt english court  (2) rule affect existing practice judge superior court shall addressed referred court respective title name irish english

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 2. (1) Save as otherwise provided by Statute or these Rules, on all
text_raw:
2. (1) Save as otherwise provided by Statute or these Rules, on all 

occasions during the sittings: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

the Judges of the Supreme Court shall wear a black woollen 
gown of uniform make with sleeves bearing green double 
ribbon banding and a single white neck tab, 

the Judges of the Court of Appeal shall wear such costume 
as is directed by the President of the Court of Appeal; 

the Judges of the High Court (including when sitting as the 
Central Criminal Court) shall wear a black gown of uniform 
nature and material with sleeves bearing a deep purple 
ribbon banding with gold trim and a single white neck tab. 

(2) A Judge appointed to the High Court before the coming into 
operation of this sub-rule may alternatively wear a black coat and vest of 
uniform make and material of the kind worn by Senior Counsel, a black 
Irish poplin gown and white bands. 

(3) A Judge shall not be required to wear a wig of a ceremonial type 

during such sittings.” 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 6th November, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [495]

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The Rules amend Order 119 of the Superior Courts to provide for new robes 
for Judges of the High Court.
